Prior to joining LBS, I worked as an Assurance Associate at EY Birmingham, where I got the opportunity to serve 11 different annual audit engagements from 6 different industries, including the Dignity.

```{r}


knitr::include_graphics("/img/ey2.jpg",error =FALSE)

```

At EY, I got to

·	Engaged in the annual audit of 11 companies; Conducted financial report audit and internal control assessment procedures for clients from 6 different industries, including transport, technology, manufacturing, professional services, funeral services etc.

·	Managed audit procedures and analytical reviews of 5 core accounts of London-listed Dignity Plc’s annual audit engagements (including group and all subsidiaries); Identified misstatements which resulted in adjustments of £1.3m in the annual report

·	Hosted 6 one-to-one client warehouse visits and inventory audit meetings on behalf of E&Y; Presented audit guidance briefings to warehouse managers on site for 6 clients; Worked with client Financial Controllers, performed 6 annual inventory system audits

·	Organised 2 virtual management enquiry meetings with client board members and 5 meetings with overseas supporting offices; Produced audit planning procedures, prepared planning analytical review reports for 3 clients from different industries

·	Nominated as only first-year representative present at all-people meeting with partners of EY Assurance (with 200+ audience)
